This restaurant came highly recommended from a local friend of a friend.  The location is right off the water and you can watch people stroll by from the patio.  The place was not busy at all (which I personally think says a lot for a Barcelona restaurant).  Service was slow, but I came to get accustomed to that in Spain.  Atmosphere was relaxed.My husband loved the croquettes, I thought they were average.  I ordered the Scampi thinking that I was getting a pasta dish with cooked unshelled shrimp, I would be wrong my friends.  They were four prawns with eyeballs and everything intact.  Is was worth a good laugh, and my poor husband ended up eating them while I ate his meal.My two cents:  Average for Barcelona.  Nothing special.
